title: How to Log Out of Netflix on Xbox

methods.name: Using the Netflix App's Support Menu

steps.headline: Open the Netflix app on your Xbox console.
steps.description: The Netflix app has a built-in function on all supported Xbox consoles that you can use to quickly log out of your account.

steps.headline: Enter the code to access the support menu.
steps.description: Using the D-pad (the cross-shaped directional button), you can enter a series of directions to bring up a shortcut with quick access to the Sign Out option. The code is as follows: up, up, down, down, left, right, left, right, up, up, up, up. You can do this from anywhere on the Netflix app (e.g., in the middle of a show).

steps.headline: Select the "Sign Out" option.
steps.description: This is at the bottom of the resulting menu; you'll have to scroll to the bottom by pressing down on either the D-pad or the left analog stick.

steps.headline: Tap the "A" button to sign out.
steps.description: This will promptly sign you out of your Netflix account and return you to the sign-in page. You can access this menu with this combination of D-pad presses on any model of Xbox after and including the Xbox 360.

steps.headline: Open the Netflix app on your Xbox One.
steps.description: This should take you to the Netflix home screen, from which you can log out via the settings menu.

steps.headline: Select the account you wish to access.
steps.description: After you select this account, you can open its settings and log out from there.

steps.headline: Tap the "B" button on your controller.
steps.description: This will bring up the Netflix menu. You can also press up on the left analog stick to access the menu.

steps.headline: Press the analog stick right until you select "settings".
steps.description: You can now open the settings menu.

steps.headline: Tap "A" on your controller.
steps.description: This will open Netflix's settings menu.

steps.headline: Select the "Log Out" option.
steps.description: This will log you out of your account!

methods.name: Using an Xbox S and Xbox 360

steps.headline: Open the Netflix app.
steps.description: Both the Xbox 360 and the Xbox S use the same process for accessing the settings menu and logging out.

steps.headline: Press the left analog stick up.
steps.description: This will bring up the menu bar.

steps.headline: Select the settings gear.
steps.description: You can do this by pressing the left analog stick left or right to navigate through the menu bar choices; stop once the settings gear is highlighted.

steps.headline: Tap "A" to open the settings menu.
steps.description: You can log out of your account from here.

steps.headline: Select the "Sign Out" option.
steps.description: Tap "A" once you've done so; you'll be prompted to confirm your choice.

steps.headline: Tap "A" over the "Yes" option.
steps.description: This will sign you out of your account! You can now sign in as a different user if you please.

text: Using the Netflix App's Support Menu Open the Netflix app on your Xbox console. The Netflix app has a built-in function on all supported Xbox consoles that you can use to quickly log out of your account. Enter the code to access the support menu. Using the D-pad (the cross-shaped directional button), you can enter a series of directions to bring up a shortcut with quick access to the Sign Out option. The code is as follows: up, up, down, down, left, right, left, right, up, up, up, up. You can do this from anywhere on the Netflix app (e.g., in the middle of a show). Select the "Sign Out" option. This is at the bottom of the resulting menu; you'll have to scroll to the bottom by pressing down on either the D-pad or the left analog stick. Tap the "A" button to sign out. This will promptly sign you out of your Netflix account and return you to the sign-in page. You can access this menu with this combination of D-pad presses on any model of Xbox after and including the Xbox 360. Using an Xbox One Open the Netflix app on your Xbox One. This should take you to the Netflix home screen, from which you can log out via the settings menu. Select the account you wish to access. After you select this account, you can open its settings and log out from there. Tap the "B" button on your controller. This will bring up the Netflix menu. You can also press up on the left analog stick to access the menu. Press the analog stick right until you select "settings". You can now open the settings menu. Tap "A" on your controller. This will open Netflix's settings menu. Select the "Log Out" option. This will log you out of your account! Using an Xbox S and Xbox 360 Open the Netflix app. Both the Xbox 360 and the Xbox S use the same process for accessing the settings menu and logging out. Press the left analog stick up. This will bring up the menu bar. Select the settings gear. You can do this by pressing the left analog stick left or right to navigate through the menu bar choices; stop once the settings gear is highlighted. Tap "A" to open the settings menu. You can log out of your account from here. Select the "Sign Out" option. Tap "A" once you've done so; you'll be prompted to confirm your choice. Tap "A" over the "Yes" option. This will sign you out of your account! You can now sign in as a different user if you please.
